description: Work + Residence Permit (Single Permit) for non-EU nationals wishing to work in Belgium long-term. Employer-initiated procedure, followed by Type D visa and municipality registration.

meta.fee_euro_approx: €180 (Visa D) + regional work permit / admin fee (varies per region)
meta.processing_time_standard: 3-4 months (Single Permit decision) + 2–4 weeks for Visa D processing
meta.passport_validity: Passport valid for at least 12 months recommended
meta.max_stay: Duration of employment contract (usually 1–3 years), renewable

documents.title: Valid Passport
documents.description: Passport with at least 12 months validity and blank pages. Color copy of bio-page and used pages if required.

documents.title: Signed Employment Contract / Job Offer
documents.description: Job offer or contract from Belgian employer; must specify role, salary, duration.

documents.title: Single Permit Application (Employer submitted)
documents.description: Application submitted by employer via the authorized regional or online counter ('Working in Belgium'). You receive permit decision (Annex 46 / 47).

documents.title: Decision Letter (Annex 46 / 47)
documents.description: Official decision granting the Single Permit. Necessary to apply for Visa D and travel to Belgium.

documents.title: Medical Certificate
documents.description: Standard medical certificate as required by Belgian law for work permit applications.

documents.title: Police Clearance Certificate (PCC)
documents.description: A clean criminal record certificate / PCC, apostilled or legalized if required.

documents.title: Health Insurance or Social Security Registration Proof
documents.description: Proof that employer will register you under Belgian social security, or have relevant health cover.

steps_flow.title: Employer Submits Single Permit Application
steps_flow.description: Belgian employer (or authorized Belgian agent) submits the Single Permit request via the official ‘Working in Belgium’ portal or regional labour authority. Includes contract, employee info, and fees.

steps_flow.title: Regional + Federal Approval Process
steps_flow.description: Region reviews work authorisation; federal Immigration Office reviews residence permit. Decision expected within ~3–4 months for admissible files.  :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}

steps_flow.title: Receive Permit Decision (Annex 46 / 47)
steps_flow.description: On approval, you get the Single Permit decision document (Annex 46 or 47), proof you’re authorised to stay & work in Belgium.

steps_flow.title: Apply for Visa D (Long-Stay) at Embassy / Consulate
steps_flow.description: Submit Annex 46 + passport + visa fees at Belgian consulate/VFS in your home country to get Type D visa for travel.

steps_flow.title: Travel to Belgium & Register at Local Municipality
steps_flow.description: Arrive with Visa D + permit decision. Within 8 working days, register at your commune (town hall). Obtain temporary residence card (Annex 49), then final residence/work card.  :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}

eligibility.required_employment: Valid job offer from Belgian employer
eligibility.other_requirements: Clean criminal record; valid passport; contract and employer sponsorship
